required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Compare Efficacy and Safety of CT-P16 and EU-Approved Avastin as First-Line Treatment for Metastatic or Recurrent Non-Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Active-Controlled, Parallel-Group, Phase 3 Study to Compare Efficacy and Safety of CT-P16 and EU-Approved Avastin as First-Line Treatment for Metastatic or Recurrent Non-Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: To demonstrate that CT-P16 is similar to US-approved Avastin in terms of efficacy determined by overall response rate (ORR) up to Cycle 6 during the Induction Study Period

primary_outcome.time_frame: Primary efficacy endpoint-Induction Study Period (around 21 weeks)

arm_group.description: Drug: Bevacizumab 15mg/kg IV of CT-16 will be administered every 3 weeks up to 6 cycles during the Induction Study Period and every 3 weeks until PD or intolerable toxicity during the Maintenance Period.

Drug: Bevacizumab 15mg/kg IV of EU-approved Avastin will be administered every 3 weeks up to 6 cycles during the Induction Study Period and every 3 weeks until PD or intolerable toxicity during the Maintenance Period.

intervention.description: 15mg/kg IV of CT-P16 every 3 weeks up to 6 cycles in the induction study period and every 3 weeks until PD occurs in the maintenance study period.
15mg/kg IV of Avastin every 3 weeks up to 6 cycles in the induction study period and every 3 weeks until PD occurs in the maintenance study period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosed as recurrent disease or stage IV
- has at least 1 measurable lesion by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumor (RECIST) Version 1.1
Exclusion Criteria:
- has predominantly squamous cell histology non-small cell lung cancer
- had surgery for metastatic nsNSCLC
